00011 #include "RegisterSearchTest.h"
00012
00013 // Add local class RegisterThread
00014 #include "RegisterThread.h"
00015
00016 using namespace std;
00017
00018 using namespace Omiscid;
00019
00020 /* @brief Usage function */
00021 void RegisterAndSearchUsage(char * ProgramName)
00022 {
00023     OmiscidError( "%s is used to demonstrate register and search methods using OMiSCID.\n", ProgramName );
00024     OmiscidError( "Usage: %s [-n <Number of services>]\n", ProgramName );
00025     OmiscidError( "Default option values:\n" );
00026     OmiscidError( "               -n <Number of services>: from 2 to 100 services. Default is 20.\n" );
00027     exit(-1);
00028 }
00029
00030 #ifdef OMISCID_RUNING_TEST
00031 // Call test in a separate function
00032 int DoRegisterSearchTest(int argc, char*argv[] )
00033 #else
00034 /* @brief main program entry. No need to give parameter */
00035 int main(int argc, char*argv[] )
00036 #endif // OMISCID_RUNING_TEST
00037 {
00038     unsigned int i;
00039     int j;
00040
00041     // Constant values
00042     // The number of service to register
00043     unsigned int NumberOfServicesToRegister = 10;
00044
00045     // A variable to store pointers on RegisterThread
00046     RegisterThread * pRegThread;
00047
00048     // parsing parameters, 0 is the program name
00049     for( j = 1 ; j < argc; j++ )
00050     {
00051         if ( argv[j][0] != '-' )
00052         {
00053             OmiscidError( "Bad parameter '%s'. See Usage :\n\n", argv[j] );
00054             RegisterAndSearchUsage(argv[0]);
00055         }
00056
00057         // Do the user ask for help
00058         if ( strcmp( argv[j], "-h" ) == 0 ||
00059              strcmp( argv[j], "-help" ) == 0 ||
00060              strcmp( argv[j], "--help" ) == 0 )
00061         {
00062             RegisterAndSearchUsage(argv[0]);
00063         }
00064
00065         // Check the number of services
00066         if ( strcmp( argv[j], "-n" ) == 0 )
00067         {
00068             j++;
00069             if ( j >= argc )
00070             {
00071                 OmiscidError( "Missing parameter value for '%s' option. See Usage :\n\n", argv[j-1] );
00072                 RegisterAndSearchUsage(argv[0]);
00073             }
00074             if ( sscanf( argv[j], "%d", &NumberOfServicesToRegister ) != 1 )
00075             {
00076                 OmiscidError( "Bad parameter value '%s' for '%s' option. See Usage :\n\n", argv[j], argv[j-1] );
00077                 RegisterAndSearchUsage(argv[0]);
00078             }
00079             if ( NumberOfServicesToRegister < 2 || NumberOfServicesToRegister > 100 )
00080             {
00081                 OmiscidError( "You must set the number of service from 2 and to 100 maximum. See Usage:\n\n" );
00082                 RegisterAndSearchUsage(argv[0]);
00083             }
00084
00085             continue;
00086         }
00087
00088         OmiscidError( "Bad parameter '%s'. See Usage :\n\n", argv[j] );
00089         RegisterAndSearchUsage(argv[0]);
00090     }
00091
00092     NumberOfServicesToRegister = 5;
00093
00094     // A simple list to store RegisterThread objects
00095     SimpleList<RegisterThread*> ListOfRegisterThreads;
00096
00097     // Variables to Compute Statics
00098     unsigned int EffectiveNumberOfRegisteredServices = 0;
00099
00100     // Print Welcome message
00101     OmiscidMessage( "This program is used to demonstrate register and search methods using OMiSCID.\n" );
00102     OmiscidMessage( "As it is ditributed, registering unique service and searching for services\n" );
00103     OmiscidMessage( "is a huge processing. See Accumulator/ClientAccumator examples for communication schema.\n\n" );
00104
00105     OmiscidMessage( "** Session parameters **\n"  );
00106     OmiscidMessage( "Number of service to register %d\n** **\n\n", NumberOfServicesToRegister );
00107
00108 // Register services
00109     OmiscidMessage( "Start to register services.\n" );
00110
00111 #ifdef OMISCID_USE_AVAHI
00112     if ( NumberOfServicesToRegister >= 10 )
00113     {
00114         OmiscidMessage( "WARNING: Avahi may crash when regestering many service in the same process\n");
00115     }
00116 #endif
00117 
00118     // Create an object to now when the total time
00119     // To register the services
00120     ElapsedTime TimeCounter;
00121
00122     for( i = 1; i <= NumberOfServicesToRegister; i++ )
00123     {
00124         // Create a new register service called
00125         pRegThread = new OMISCID_TLM RegisterThread(i);
00126         // if ok
00127         if ( pRegThread != (RegisterThread*)NULL )
00128         {
00129             pRegThread->Start();
00130             // add it to my list of threads
00131             ListOfRegisterThreads.Add( pRegThread );
00132         }
00133     }
00134
00135     // Get number of waited services
00136     EffectiveNumberOfRegisteredServices = ListOfRegisterThreads.GetNumberOfElements();
00137
00138     // Wait until all registered services are present
00139     OmiscidMessage( "Wait for service to be ready.\n" );
00140     for(;;)
00141     {
00142         // Wait for all create thread to register their service
00143         if ( (unsigned int)RegisterThread::NbRegistered == EffectiveNumberOfRegisteredServices )
00144         {
00145             break;
00146         }
00147
00148         // If not done, wait 10 ms maximum for a new service registration
00149         RegisterThread::NewServiceIsRegistered.Wait(10);
00150     }
00151
00152     OmiscidMessage( "=> %d service(s) are registered in %u ms.\n", EffectiveNumberOfRegisteredServices, TimeCounter.Get() );
00153
00154 // Search for services, *can be done* in another process/computer over the network obvioulsly !
00155
00156     // First, in order to serach for service, we need to create a service event if it is
00157     // not register. This service will ne be visible.
00158     Service * Searcher = ServiceFactory.Create( "Searcher" );
00159
00160     if ( Searcher == NULL )
00161     {
00162         // print there is a problem
00163         OmiscidError( "Problem creating 'Searcher' service.\n" );
00164
00165         // Free all registred service
00166         // 1er way to walk among the SimpleList
00167         while( ListOfRegisterThreads.GetNumberOfElements() != 0 )
00168         {
00169             // Get and remove the first element in the list
00170             // and it can not be NULL, delete it
00171             delete ListOfRegisterThreads.ExtractFirst();
00172
00173             exit(-1);
00174         }
00175     }
00176
00177 // First, search only one service named RegisterThread and get a ServiceProxy for it
00178     OmiscidMessage( "Search for single RegisterThread service.\n" );
00179
00180     // Reinit ElapsedTime object
00181     TimeCounter.Reset();
00182
00183     // Search for a service, wait at max 5 s (5000 ms) to get an answer. We provide
00184     // Create filter (automatically create by NameIs and automatically destroyed by FindService
00185     ServiceFilter * MySearch = NameIs("RegisterThread");
00186
00187     ServiceProxy * OneService = Searcher->FindService(MySearch, 5000);
00188
00189     // Free the ServiceFilter. As it is a simple one, call to Empty is not mandatory
00190     MySearch->Empty();
00191     delete MySearch;
00192
00193     if ( OneService != NULL )
00194     {
00195         OmiscidMessage( "=> service 'RegisterThread' found in %u ms.\n", TimeCounter.Get() );
00196
00197         // Delete
00198         delete OneService;
00199     }
00200     else
00201     {
00202         OmiscidError( "=> service 'RegisterThread' not found.\n" );
00203     }
00204
00205 // Now Search for all services named RegisterThread and get a ServiceProxyList for Them
00206     OmiscidMessage( "Search all services named RegisterThread.\n" );
00207
00208     // We need to a filters list, give a NameIs filter for each service
00209     ServiceFilterList ListOfFilters;
00210     for( i = 1; i <= EffectiveNumberOfRegisteredServices; i++ )
00211     {
00212         ListOfFilters.Add( NameIs("RegisterThread") );
00213     }
00214
00215     // Reset time counter
00216     TimeCounter.Reset();
00217     // Search for services, wait forever (no second parameter given) to get an answer
00218     // Get in return a ServiceProxy List
00219     ServiceProxyList * MultipleServices = Searcher->FindServices( ListOfFilters /*, 0 = default */ );
00220
00221     // MultipleServices != NULL can not be null as we do not got out of FindServices without
00222     // an answer
00223     OmiscidMessage( "=> services found in %u ms.\n", TimeCounter.Get() );
00224
00225     // Delete answer
00226     delete MultipleServices;
00227
00228     // Empty the filter list to reset it
00229     ListOfFilters.Empty();
00230
00231 // Now Search for all services named RegisterThread with a pair number and get a ServiceProxyList for Them
00232     OmiscidMessage( "Search for all RegisterThread services with a pair number.\n" );
00233
00234     // We need to a filters list, give a NameIs filter for each service
00235     for( i = 2; i <= EffectiveNumberOfRegisteredServices; i += 2 )
00236     {
00237         ListOfFilters.Add( And(NameIs("RegisterThread"),HasVariable("Number",i)) );
00238     }
00239
00240     // Reset time counter
00241     TimeCounter.Reset();
00242     // Search for services, wait forever (no second parameter given) to get an answer
00243     // Get in return a ServiceProxy List
00244     MultipleServices = Searcher->FindServices( ListOfFilters /*, 0 = default */ );
00245
00246     // MultipleServices != NULL can not be null as we do not got out of FindServices without
00247     // an answer
00248     OmiscidMessage( "=> services found in %u ms.\n", TimeCounter.Get() );
00249
00250     // Print information about found service
00251     for( MultipleServices->First(); MultipleServices->NotAtEnd(); MultipleServices->Next() )
00252     {
00253         // in order to write shorter lines below
00254         ServiceProxy * pProxy = MultipleServices->GetCurrent();
00255         cerr << pProxy->GetName() << " (" << pProxy->GetPeerIdAsString() << ") is number "
00256              << pProxy->GetVariableValue("Number") << endl;
00257     }
00258
00259 // Now Search for specific service which is not a specific one
00260     MultipleServices->First();
00261     OmiscidMessage( "Search for single RegisterThread which is not %8.8x.\n", MultipleServices->GetCurrent()->GetPeerId() );
00262
00263     // Reset time counter
00264     TimeCounter.Reset();
00265     // Search for services, wait forever (no second parameter given) to get an answer
00266     // Get in return a ServiceProxy List
00267     MySearch = Not(MultipleServices->GetCurrent());
00268
00269     OneService = Searcher->FindService( MySearch );
00270
00271     // Free the ServiceFilter. As it is a simple one, call to Empty is not mandatory
00272     MySearch->Empty();
00273     delete MySearch;
00274
00275     // MultipleServices != NULL can not be null as we do not got out of FindServices without
00276     // an answer
00277     OmiscidMessage( "=> service %8.8x found in %u ms.\n", OneService->GetPeerId(), TimeCounter.Get() );
00278
00279     // Delete last ServiceProxy
00280     delete OneService;
00281
00282     // Delete answer
00283     delete MultipleServices;
00284
00285 // Unregister service and close all connections
00286     OmiscidMessage( "Unregister service and close all connections.\n" );
00287     // Reset time counter
00288     TimeCounter.Reset();
00289     // Delete registered thread
00290     while( ListOfRegisterThreads.IsNotEmpty() )
00291     {
00292         delete ListOfRegisterThreads.ExtractFirst();
00293     }
00294     OmiscidMessage( "=> done in %u ms.\n", TimeCounter.Get() );
00295
00296     // delete the Search service
00297     delete Searcher;
00298
00299 #ifndef OMISCID_RUNING_TEST
00300     // printf use for autotest, except when using GlobalTest procedure
00301     printf( "Test ok.\n" );
00302     fflush( stdout );
00303 #endif
00304 
00305 #ifdef WIN32
00306     // Create an even in order to Stop here forever
00307     Event Forever;
00308     // Forever.Wait();
00309 #endif
00310 
00311     // exit
00312     return 0;
00313 }
